author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves establishing the ability to block external domain names that are deemed malicious or pose a threat to the organization's network. This includes configuring DNS filtering, firewalls, and other security appliances to effectively block access to these domains. It is essential for preventing unauthorized access and mitigating potential attacks from external sources.

requirements.description: Staff must be trained and qualified to perform this capability effectively.
Documented procedures and playbooks must be available for executing this capability.
Network monitoring tools and access to network infrastructure for analysis and control.

title: Establish Ability to Block External Domains

references.name: DNS Security and Network Filtering Best Practices
NIST SP 800-81 Rev. 2: Secure Domain Name System (DNS) Deployment Guide
CISA Alert: DNS Infrastructure Hijacking Campaign
